entry.title: Combined summary - txtool: Advanced transaction building and fun
entry.summary: Txtool is a command line tool built in node.js that allows for building complex bitcoin transactions. It was created by Jeff Garzik, Senior Software Engineer and open source evangelist at BitPay, Inc., to demonstrate advanced bitcoin features and make it easier for users to experiment with them. The intended audience has a basic understanding of bitcoin transactions. Txtool interfaces with Bitcoin-Qt/bitcoind. On GitHub, the full list of commands and theory of operation can be found. Some of the working examples available on txtool include multi-signature transaction building and passing around transactions for signing.Txtool aims to demonstrate advanced bitcoin features and make it easier for users to experiment with them. The full list of commands and theory of operation can be found on GitHub. The tool includes working examples such as multi-signature transaction building and passing around transactions for signing. Additional examples will soon be demonstrated including decentralized crowdfunding and atomic coin swapping. The target audience is those who have a basic understanding of bitcoin transactions.Jeff Garzik, Senior Software Engineer and open source evangelist at BitPay, Inc., created txtool. It is a command line tool written in node.js that interfaces with Bitcoin-Qt/bitcoind to assist in building complex transactions. Txtool's goal is to make it easier for users to experiment with advanced bitcoin features.
